intro: Jundzillia draba, commonly known as the alpine draba, is a flowering plant belonging to the Brassicaceae family. It is a small, herbaceous annual or biennial plant that typically grows in alpine and subalpine regions. The plant has basal leaves that are oblanceolate or elliptic in shape, and its flowers are small, white or pale yellow, arranged in a single cluster. It is characterized by its short stature and ability to thrive in nutrient-poor soils. Jundzillia draba is often found in rocky or gravelly habitats at high elevations.
